name: Pope Pius XI
summary: Pius XI, born Ambrogio Damiano Achille Ratti, was Pope from 1922 to 1939. He signed the Lateran Treaty with Italy in 1929, establishing Vatican City as an independent state and resolving the Roman Question. He promoted Catholic Action and missionary work. He condemned both communism and Nazism in the encyclicals 'Divini Redemptoris' (1937) and 'Mit brennender Sorge' (1937). He supported the Mexican Cristeros against anti-clerical persecution. He encouraged scholarly work, establishing the Pontifical Academy of Sciences.
